thread.title: Inventor and InventHelp Client Develops Novelty Lunchbox (LAX-634)
thread.title_full: Inventor and InventHelp Client Develops Novelty Lunchbox (LAX-634) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Inventor and InventHelp Client Develops Novelty Lunchbox (LAX-634)
text:
A Pittsburgh-based invention company, InventHelp is submitting the GERMAINE to companies in the hopes of a good faith review.
PITTSBURGH, PA
"Our 5-year-old daughter often plays with her food containers and lunchbox like they are toys," said one of two inventors from Monrovia, Calif. "We thought that if lunchboxes were made to be more entertaining and engaging, they could really be toys in addition to food-storage containers."
They developed the patent-pending GERMAINE to be fun and engaging. It promotes playtime and the use of imagination. This ensures that children are not bored. The lunchbox also provides a great way to transport food, beverages and snacks, and it prevents items inside from spilling out of the container. Additionally, the unit offers hours of excitement.
The original design was submitted to the Los Angeles office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-LAX-634, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
